japanese.enphrase: The collaboration of these two artists made this wonderful song.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Futari no âthisuto ga korabo shite subarasii kyoku o tsukutta.
japanese.fnphrase: 二人のアーティストがコラボして素晴らしい曲を作った。

japanese.enphrase: Take the umbrella with you, as it looks like it's going to rain.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Amega furisou dakara, kasa o motte itta houga iiyo.
japanese.fnphrase: 雨が降りそうだから、傘を持って行った方がいいよ。

japanese.enphrase: The owner of the apartment demands the security deposit of one month's rent and another one month for the key money.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono apâto no shikikin to reikin ga sorezore ikkagetsubun hitsuyou da.
japanese.fnphrase: このアパートの敷金と礼金がそれぞれ1か月分必要だ。

japanese.enphrase: Remember to bring a souvenir for your friends after returning from traveling.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ryokou no ato wa, tomodachi ni omiyage o wasurenaide.
japanese.fnphrase: 旅行の後は、友達にお土産を忘れないで。

japanese.enphrase: It reminds me of my mother's cooking.
japanese.fnphrase: 母の料理が懐かしい。

japanese.enphrase: Do not eat too many sweets for a snack.
japanese.fnphrase: お菓子を食べすぎないで。

japanese.enphrase: I am very happy to have my children.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kodomo ni megumarete totemo shiawase desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 子供に恵まれてとても幸せです。

japanese.enphrase: The grandpa's way of thinking is old.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano ojiisan no kangaekata wa furui.
japanese.fnphrase: あのおじいさんの考え方は古い。

japanese.enphrase: This company's retirement age is 65.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono kaisha no teinen wa 65 sai desu.
japanese.fnphrase: この会社の定年は65歳です。

japanese.enphrase: The deadline of the application is tomorrow.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gansho no shimekiri wa asu desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 願書の締め切りは明日です。

japanese.enphrase: A banker earns a lot of money.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ginkouin wa okane o takusan kasegu.
japanese.fnphrase: 銀行員はお金をたくさん稼ぐ。

japanese.enphrase: This is not enough.
japanese.fnphrase: これだけじゃ足りないです。

japanese.enphrase: The breakfast was not tasty.
japanese.fnphrase: 朝ごはんはまずかった。

japanese.enphrase: Cell phones are very convenient.
japanese.fnphrase: 携帯はとても便利です。

japanese.enphrase: I watered my flower.
japanese.fnphrase: 花に水をやった。

japanese.enphrase: Thank you for lending me the book.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Hon o kashite kurete doumo arigatou.
japanese.fnphrase: 本を貸してくれてどうもありがとう。

japanese.enphrase: No thank you. I am full.
japanese.fnphrase: お腹がいっぱいなので結構です。

japanese.enphrase: You must say "Shitsureishimasu" when you enter the president's room.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Shachou no heya ni hairu toki wa "shitsurei shimasu" to iwanakereba naranai.
japanese.fnphrase: 社長の部屋に入るときは「失礼します」と言わなければならない。

japanese.enphrase: My brother does not say "I'm sorry", no matter what he does.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Otouto wa nani o shitemo "gomennasai" to iwanai.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟は何をしても「ごめんなさい。」と言わない。

japanese.enphrase: Excuse me. Please give me this.
japanese.fnphrase: すみません。これをください。

japanese.enphrase: I said "I am very sorry about that" to the client when I accidentally stepped on his foot.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Okyakusama no ashi o funde shimattanode, "shitsurei simashita" to iimashita.
japanese.fnphrase: お客様の足を踏んでしまったので、「失礼しました」といいました。

japanese.enphrase: I do not want to marry a mama's boy.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mazakon no otoko towa kekkon shitakunai.
japanese.fnphrase: マザコンの男とは結婚したくない。

japanese.enphrase: Environmental issues are everybody's problem.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kankyoumondai wa minna no mondai da.
japanese.fnphrase: 環境問題はみんなの問題だ。

japanese.enphrase: Let's take the shortcut home.
japanese.fnphrase: 近道して家に帰ろう。

japanese.enphrase: It's hard to have this much overtime work.
japanese.fnphrase: 残業が多くて大変だ。

japanese.enphrase: I saw an old neighbor at the supermarket and asked him "How are you?"
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sûpâ de kinjo no ojiisan ni atta node, "ogenkidesuka" to kiita.
japanese.fnphrase: スーパーで近所のおじいさんに会ったので、「お元気ですか」と聞いた。

japanese.enphrase: The students have been distracted.
japanese.fnphrase: 学生がだれてきた。

japanese.enphrase: It would be good to buy it when it is a bargain.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Bâgen no toki ni katta houga iiyo.
japanese.fnphrase: バーゲンの時に買った方がいいよ。

japanese.enphrase: When I scolded a student who was smoking, he snapped at me.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tabako o sutteiru gakusei o chuui shitara gyakugire sareta.
japanese.fnphrase: タバコを吸っている学生を注意したら、逆ギレされた。

japanese.enphrase: I went to the airport to pick up my aunt.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Oba o kuukou made mukae ni itta.
japanese.fnphrase: おばを空港まで迎えに行った。

japanese.translation: I have not seen you for a long time.
japanese.enphrase: I said "I have not seen you for a long time" to my teacher because 2 years has been past since I saw him last.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sannen buri ni sensei ni atta node, "ohisashiburidesu" to itta.
japanese.fnphrase: ３年ぶりに先生に会ったので、「お久しぶりです」と言った。

japanese.enphrase: See you later, Mr. Tanaka.
japanese.fnphrase: じゃあ、また。田中さん。

japanese.enphrase: This dress is a good bargain.
japanese.fnphrase: このドレスがお買い得です。

japanese.enphrase: We lost today's match.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Bokutachi no kyou no shiai wa kuroboshi datta.
japanese.fnphrase: 僕たちの今日の試合は黒星だった。

japanese.enphrase: I think I will go to Tokyo tomorrow.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Asu toukyou ni ikou to omoi masu.
japanese.fnphrase: 明日、東京に行こうと思います。

japanese.enphrase: I got very tired yesterday.
japanese.fnphrase: 昨日はとても疲れた。

japanese.enphrase: It's time for a snack.
japanese.fnphrase: おやつの時間ですよ。

japanese.enphrase: Many companies went out of business due to the recession.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Fukeiki de takusan no kaisha ga tousan shita.
japanese.fnphrase: 不景気でたくさんの会社が倒産した。

japanese.enphrase: I am good at math.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa suugaku ga tokui desu
japanese.fnphrase: 私は数学が得意です。

japanese.enphrase: I owe you one.
japanese.fnphrase: 恩に着るよ。

japanese.enphrase: I am poor at physics.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa butsuri ga nigate desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は物理が苦手です。

japanese.enphrase: I heard that company is making a profit.
japanese.fnphrase: あの会社は儲かっているらしい。

japanese.enphrase: I considered a better way.
japanese.fnphrase: もっといい方法を考えた。

japanese.enphrase: Doing dishes is my job.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Araimono wa watashi no shigoto desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 洗い物は私の仕事です。

japanese.enphrase: I gave my brother some sweets.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟にお菓子を上げた。

japanese.enphrase: We won the game after losing many.
japanese.fnphrase: 久しぶりの白星だ。

japanese.enphrase: My daily life is fulfilling.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mainichi no seikatsu ga juujitsu shiteiru.
japanese.fnphrase: 毎日の生活が充実している。

japanese.enphrase: I passed the entrance exam of the university.
japanese.fnphrase: 大学試験に合格した。

japanese.enphrase: You had better not carry cash around.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Genkin o amari mochiarukanai houga ii.
japanese.fnphrase: 現金をあまり持ち歩かないほうがいい。

japanese.enphrase: I have an allergy to pollen.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は花粉アレルギーです。

japanese.enphrase: Let's split the bill.
japanese.fnphrase: 割り勘で払おう。

japanese.enphrase: I have not yet read the entertainment news today.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kyou no entame nyûsu o mada yonde inai.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日のエンタメニュースをまだ読んでいない。

japanese.enphrase: I got the ticket for the concert.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Konsâto no chiketto o getto shitayo.
japanese.fnphrase: コンサートのチケットをゲットした。

japanese.enphrase: Do not make him your enemy.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare o teki ni mawasanai houga iidesuyo.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼を敵にまわさないほうがいいですよ。

japanese.enphrase: He is our ally.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼が私たちの味方だ。

japanese.enphrase: I would like to study abroad in France.
japanese.fnphrase: フランスに留学してみたい。

japanese.enphrase: I really appreciate my parents.
japanese.fnphrase: 両親に感謝しています。

japanese.enphrase: I plan to go to a high school reunion in October.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Juugatsu ni koukou no dousoukai ni iku yotei desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 10月に高校の同窓会に行く予定です。

japanese.enphrase: He graduated from Kyoto University.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare wa kyouto daigaku no sotsugyousei da.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼は京都大学の卒業生だ。

japanese.enphrase: I tried hard, but it was in vain in the end.
japanese.fnphrase: がんばったのに、結局だめだった。

japanese.enphrase: Do your best, Mr. Yamada.
japanese.fnphrase: 山田さん、がんばってね。

japanese.enphrase: I was absent from an important meeting.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Daijina kaigi ni kesseki site shimatta.
japanese.fnphrase: 大事な会議に欠席してしまった。

japanese.enphrase: I plan to attend the party next week.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Raishuu no pâthî ni shusseki suru tsumori desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 来週のパーティーに出席するつもりです。

japanese.enphrase: I look similar to my mother.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa haha ni sokkuri desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は母にそっくりです。

japanese.enphrase: I want to retire early.
japanese.fnphrase: 早く退職したいです。

japanese.enphrase: Snow plowing is hard in winter.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Fuyu wa yukikaki ga taihen desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 冬は雪かきが大変です。

japanese.enphrase: My father is a cheerful person.
japanese.fnphrase: 父は楽しい人です。

japanese.enphrase: I look forward to having a Thanksgiving feast.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kanshasai no gochisou ga tanoshimi desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 感謝祭のご馳走が楽しみです。

japanese.enphrase: I cleaned my room.
japanese.fnphrase: 部屋を掃除した。

japanese.enphrase: Because it is bad weather today, I cannot do laundry.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Otenki ga warui kara, sentaku wa dekinai.
japanese.fnphrase: お天気が悪いから、洗濯はできない。

japanese.enphrase: It is not good to go to a dangerous place.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Abunai tokoro e ittewa dame desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 危ない所へ行ってはだめです。

japanese.enphrase: My lower back hurts and cannot move.
japanese.fnphrase: 腰が痛くて動けません。

japanese.enphrase: It is dry today.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日は乾燥してるね。

japanese.enphrase: I want to eat delicious sushi.
japanese.fnphrase: おいしいすしを食べたい。

japanese.enphrase: I could see beautiful scenery from my window.
japanese.fnphrase: 窓から美しい景色が見えた。

japanese.enphrase: New Hampshire is a pretty state.
japanese.fnphrase: ニューハンプシャー州はきれいです。

japanese.enphrase: Cell phones are very convenient.
japanese.fnphrase: 携帯電話はとても便利だ。

japanese.enphrase: I do not want to live in an inconvenient town.
japanese.fnphrase: 不便な町に住みたくない。

japanese.enphrase: Please turn on the air conditioner because it is hot.
japanese.fnphrase: 暑いから、エアコンをつけて。

japanese.enphrase: I want to read an interesting book.
japanese.fnphrase: おもしろい本が読みたい。

japanese.enphrase: When is your birthday?
japanese.fnphrase: 誕生日はいつですか。

japanese.enphrase: I am planning to go to Japan in July.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Shichigatsu ni nihon ni iku tsumori desu.
japanese.fnphrase: ７月に日本に行くつもりです。

japanese.enphrase: Let's go to the mall on Sunday.
japanese.fnphrase: 日曜日にモールに行きましょう。

japanese.enphrase: That student always forgets to do his homework.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano gakusei wa itsumo shukudai o wasurete kuru.
japanese.fnphrase: あの学生はいつも宿題を忘れてくる

japanese.enphrase: I want to go to Japan.
japanese.fnphrase: 日本に行きたい。

japanese.enphrase: I saw an interesting movie yesterday.
japanese.fnphrase: 昨日、おもしろい映画を見た。

japanese.enphrase: I am studying French.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ima furansugo o benkyou shite imasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 今、フランス語を勉強しています。

japanese.enphrase: I am going to buy a new computer.
japanese.fnphrase: 新しいコンピュータを買いに行きます。

japanese.enphrase: Before eating, we say "let's eat."
japanese.fnphrase: 食べる前に「いただきます。」と言います。

japanese.enphrase: I said "Good morning" to my teacher when I saw her.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Asa sensei ni atta toki "ohayougozaimasu" to itta.
japanese.fnphrase: 朝、先生に会った時「おはようございます。」と言った。

japanese.enphrase: When I saw my teacher at a convenience store, I said "Good evening".
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Yoru, konbini de sensei ni attatoki "konbanwa" to iimashita.
japanese.fnphrase: 夜、コンビ二で先生に会った時「こんばんは」と言いました。

japanese.enphrase: My name is Tanaka. Nice to meet you.
japanese.fnphrase: はじめまして。田中です。どうぞよろしく。

japanese.enphrase: I cannot do anything because I am hungry.
japanese.fnphrase: おなかがすいて、何もできない。

japanese.enphrase: I am so thirsty, I feel like I am dying.
japanese.fnphrase: のどがかわいて、死にそうです。

japanese.enphrase: You are welcome. If there is anything I can do, please let me know.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Douitashimashite. Mata nanika attara itte kudasai.
japanese.fnphrase: どういたしまして。また何かあったら、言ってください。

japanese.enphrase: I bought lunch at a convenience store.
japanese.fnphrase: コンビニでお昼ご飯を買った。

japanese.enphrase: May I borrow an eraser?
japanese.fnphrase: 消しゴムを貸してください。

japanese.enphrase: Please turn on the electricity.
japanese.fnphrase: ちょっと、電気つけて。

japanese.enphrase: That movie is great.
japanese.fnphrase: あの映画はすごいよ。

japanese.enphrase: I want to go to France but the airplane ticket is too expensive to go.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Furansu ni ikitai kedo hikoukidai ga takasugite ikenai.
japanese.fnphrase: フランスに行きたいけど、飛行機代が高すぎて行けない。

japanese.enphrase: Going to Japan is not cheap.
japanese.fnphrase: 日本に行くのは安くない。

japanese.enphrase: The majority of greenhouse gas is carbon dioxide.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Onshitsukoukagasu no daibubun wa nisankatanso da.
japanese.fnphrase: 温室効果ガスの大部分は二酸化炭素だ。

japanese.enphrase: We must reduce carbon dioxide emissions.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Nisankatanso no haishuturyou o herasanakereba naranai.
japanese.fnphrase: 二酸化炭素の排出量を減らさなければならない。

japanese.enphrase: My sister is left-handed.
japanese.fnphrase: 姉は左利きです。

japanese.enphrase: Bullying is a big problem.
japanese.fnphrase: いじめは大きな問題だ。

japanese.enphrase: I have a new boyfriend.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼ができました。

japanese.enphrase: I went on a date with my girlfriend.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼女とデートしました。

japanese.enphrase: I cannot go to work without makeup.
japanese.fnphrase: すっぴんで仕事にいけない。

japanese.enphrase: Why don't we have tea at a family restaurant?
japanese.fnphrase: ファミレスでお茶しない？

japanese.enphrase: It is difficult to be a professional.
japanese.fnphrase: プロになるのは難しい。

japanese.enphrase: The price is a rip-off.
japanese.fnphrase: その値段はぼったくりだ。

japanese.enphrase: My friend treated me.
japanese.fnphrase: 友達におごってもらった。

japanese.enphrase: I am studying music theory.
japanese.fnphrase: 音楽を学んでいます。

japanese.enphrase: I asked my teacher about the test.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sensei ni tesuto no koto o kiki mashita.
japanese.fnphrase: 先生にテストの事をききました。

japanese.enphrase: If you go toward this road, you will be close.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono michi o totte iku to chikai desuyo.
japanese.fnphrase: この道を通っていくと近いですよ。

japanese.enphrase: Someone, please help me!
japanese.fnphrase: だれか、助けて！

japanese.enphrase: I took my brother to a park.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Otouto o tsurete kouen ni itta.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟を連れて公園へ行った。

japanese.enphrase: I will bring my friends back to my house.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tomodachi o ie ni tsurete kuru tsumori desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 友達を家に連れて来るつもりです。

japanese.translation: to take something to a place
japanese.enphrase: You must not take your game to school.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gakkou ni gêmu o motte ittewa ikemasen.
japanese.fnphrase: 学校にゲームを持って行ってはいけません。

japanese.translation: to bring something to a place
japanese.enphrase: You do not have to bring anything when you come to my house.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Uchi ni kurutoki, omiyage o motte konakutemo iidesuyo.
japanese.fnphrase: うちに来る時、お土産を持ってこなくてもいいですよ。

japanese.enphrase: I bought a used car.
japanese.fnphrase: 中古の車を買った。

japanese.enphrase: I will move to Florida next week.
japanese.fnphrase: 来週フロリダに引越します。

japanese.enphrase: I lost my key and I am looking for it.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kagi o nakushita node sagashite imasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 鍵をなくしたので、探しています。

japanese.enphrase: I found my lost key.
japanese.fnphrase: なくした鍵を見つけた。

japanese.enphrase: Because I do not have enough money for a security deposit, I cannot move to a new place.
japanese.fnphrase: 敷金がないから引っ越せません。

japanese.enphrase: May I go to the restroom?
japanese.fnphrase: お手洗いに行ってもいいですか。

japanese.enphrase: I am tone deaf.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は音痴だ。

japanese.enphrase: Please be quiet.
japanese.fnphrase: 静かにしてください。

japanese.enphrase: I am too full to move.
japanese.fnphrase: おなかがいっぱいで、動けない。

japanese.enphrase: Please take care of yourself so that you will not get sick.
japanese.fnphrase: 病気にならないように、気をつけてね。

japanese.enphrase: Could you put hot water in the bath tub?
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ofuro ni oyu o irete kureru?
japanese.fnphrase: お風呂にお湯を入れてくれる？

japanese.enphrase: That way is the roundabout route.
japanese.fnphrase: その道は遠回りだよ。

japanese.enphrase: Recently the number of soccer fans is increasing.
japanese.fnphrase: 最近サッカーファンが増えてきている。

japanese.enphrase: Dinner is ready.
japanese.fnphrase: ご飯が出来たよ。

japanese.enphrase: I am very happy that I was able to win.
japanese.fnphrase: 優勝できてうれしいです。

japanese.enphrase: I like handsome men.
japanese.fnphrase: イケメンが好きです。

japanese.enphrase: That girl is very attractive.
japanese.fnphrase: あの子いかしているね。

japanese.enphrase: She is very skinny.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kanojo wa garigari ni yasete iru.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼女はがりがりにやせている。

japanese.enphrase: He has good grades because he is a nerd.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Aitsu wa gariben dakara benkyou ga dekirunnda.
japanese.fnphrase: あいつはガリ勉だから勉強ができるんだ。

japanese.enphrase: There are hard times and good times in life.
japanese.fnphrase: 人生山あり谷あり

japanese.enphrase: A once in a lifetime chance came to me.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Isshou ni ichido no chansu ga yatte kita.
japanese.fnphrase: 一生に一度のチャンスがやってきた。

japanese.enphrase: I want to eat a croissant.
japanese.fnphrase: クロワッサンが食べたい。

japanese.enphrase: Mr. Tanaka is good at tennis.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tanaka san wa tenisu ga jouzu desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんはテニスが上手です。

japanese.enphrase: I am poor at drawing.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa e o kakunoga heta desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は絵を描くのが下手です。

japanese.enphrase: While there is life, there is hope.
japanese.fnphrase: 命あってのものだね。

japanese.enphrase: I made a mistake.
japanese.fnphrase: ドジをしてしまった。

japanese.enphrase: His theory is full of contradictions.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare no riron wa mujun darake da.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼の理論は矛盾だらけだ。

japanese.enphrase: It is only your loss if you do this.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Konna koto o shitemo son na dake dayo.
japanese.fnphrase: こんなことをしても、損なだけだよ。

japanese.enphrase: Mr. Tanaka has a lucky nature and is loved by everybody.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tanaka san wa darekara mo sukareru toku na seikaku da.
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんはだれからも好かれる得な性格だ。

japanese.enphrase: He is good for an amateur.
japanese.fnphrase: アマチュアにしては上手です。

japanese.enphrase: I am not dating anyone.
japanese.fnphrase: 今、付き合っている人はいません。

japanese.enphrase: My older sister is not married yet.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ane wa mada kekkon shite imasen
japanese.fnphrase: 姉はまだ結婚していません。

japanese.enphrase: I dislike studying.
japanese.fnphrase: 勉強が嫌いです。

japanese.enphrase: I like chocolate.
japanese.fnphrase: チョコレートが好きです。

japanese.enphrase: That grandpa is old.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano ojiisan wa toshi o totteiru.
japanese.fnphrase: あのおじいさんは年をとっている。

japanese.enphrase: I have three dogs.
japanese.fnphrase: 犬を３匹飼っています。

japanese.enphrase: He had ten regular customers to his restaurant in one week.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kareno resutoran niwa isshuukan ni juunin no ripîtâ ga atta.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼のレストランには一週間に10人のリピーターがあった。

japanese.enphrase: The breakup of the famous couple was reported in every newspaper in the world.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Yuumei na kappuru no hakyoku wa sekaijuu subeteno shinbun de tsutae rarete.
japanese.fnphrase: 有名なカップルの破局は世界中のすべての新聞で伝えられた。

japanese.enphrase: She spent all her savings to dress up like a celebrity.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kanojo wa serebu no youni kikazaru tameni, chokin o tsukai hatashita.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼女はセレブのように着飾るために、貯金を使い果たした。

japanese.enphrase: That bag is super cute!
japanese.fnphrase: あのバッグ、めっちゃかわいい！

japanese.enphrase: I don't want to be with him, as he only tells jokes that appeal to old people.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Oyaji gyagu bakari iukara, karetowa issho ni itakunai.
japanese.fnphrase: オヤジギャグばかり言うから、彼とは一緒にいたくない。

japanese.enphrase: Congratulations on your engagement.
japanese.fnphrase: ご婚約、おめでとう。

japanese.enphrase: I want to eat delicious sweets.
japanese.fnphrase: おいしいスイーツが食べたい。

japanese.translation: basement floors of a department store
japanese.enphrase: The basement of the department store is always crowded.
japanese.fnphrase: デパ地下はいつも混んでるね。

japanese.enphrase: Is Ms. Tanaka Mr. Yamada's e-mailing friend?
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tanaka san wa yamada san to merutomo nano?
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんは山田さんとメル友なの？

japanese.enphrase: Chestnuts are in season now.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ima wa kuri ga shun da.
japanese.fnphrase: 今は栗が旬だ。

japanese.enphrase: The autumn foliage in Kyoto is beautiful.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kyouto no kouyou wa totemo kirei da.
japanese.fnphrase: 京都の紅葉はとてもきれいだ。

japanese.enphrase: Saving energy is important.
japanese.fnphrase: 省エネは大切だ。

japanese.enphrase: I am trying to save electricity by setting the air conditioner at 78 F.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Eakon o nijuurokudo ni settei shite setsuden ni tsutomete imasu.
japanese.fnphrase: エアコンを26度に設定して節電につとめています。

japanese.enphrase: It is better to eat organic vegetables.
japanese.fnphrase: 有機野菜を食べた方がいい。

japanese.enphrase: Grey color is trend this year.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kotoshi no ryuukou wa gurê rashii.
japanese.fnphrase: 今年の流行はグレーらしい。

japanese.enphrase: Why don't we go to the arcade, since we have nothing to do?
japanese.fnphrase: ひまなのでゲーセンでも行こう

japanese.enphrase: This song is popular now.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono uta ga ima hayatte iru.
japanese.fnphrase: この歌が今はやっている

japanese.enphrase: Mr. Oshima has been acting cool lately.
japanese.fnphrase: 大島君、最近イケてるね。

japanese.enphrase: This sake tastes good.
japanese.fnphrase: このお酒はなかなかいけるね。

japanese.enphrase: Do not rush.
japanese.fnphrase: あせらないで。

japanese.enphrase: Please take your time today.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日はゆっくりしていってください。

japanese.enphrase: I have club activities, so I will come home late.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sâkuru ga arukara, osoku naru yo
japanese.fnphrase: サークルがあるから、おそくなるよ。

japanese.enphrase: I plan to stay at a bed and breakfast.
japanese.fnphrase: ペンションに泊まる予定です。

japanese.enphrase: I would like to live in the countryside in the future.
japanese.fnphrase: 将来は田舎に暮らしたい。

japanese.enphrase: It is cold; please turn the heater on.
japanese.fnphrase: 寒いからストーブをつけて。

japanese.enphrase: Could you go and see if I turned off the stove?
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Konro no hi o keshitaka mite morae masuka?
japanese.fnphrase: コンロの火を消したか見てもらえますか？

japanese.enphrase: That person is a famous movie director.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Anohito wa yuumei na eiga kantoku dayo.
japanese.fnphrase: あの人は有名な映画監督だよ。

japanese.enphrase: I study every day for the entrance exam.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Nyuushi no tameni mainichi benkyou shiteimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 入試のために毎日勉強してます。

japanese.enphrase: I bought a new dress for a group blind date.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Goukon no tameni atarashii fuku o kata.
japanese.fnphrase: 合コンのために新しい服を買った。

japanese.enphrase: Don't be mean to others.
japanese.fnphrase: 意地悪をしちゃだめだよ。

japanese.enphrase: That woman is really stingy.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano obasan, hontou ni kechi da.
japanese.fnphrase: あのおばさん、本当にけちだ。

japanese.enphrase: What's so funny?
japanese.fnphrase: 何がそんなにおかしいの？

japanese.enphrase: Don't speak with any strange people.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Hen na hito to hanashi o shitewa damedayo.
japanese.fnphrase: 変な人と話をしてはだめだよ。

japanese.enphrase: You are annoying.
japanese.fnphrase: 鬱陶しい人だね。

japanese.enphrase: You are fashionable.
japanese.fnphrase: おしゃれですね。

japanese.enphrase: That man is tasteful.
japanese.fnphrase: あのおじさん、渋いね。

japanese.enphrase: That teacher is creepy.
japanese.fnphrase: あの先生、きもいね。

japanese.enphrase: Today is comfortably cool.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kyou wa suzushikute kimochi ga iine.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日は涼しくて気持ちがいいね。

japanese.enphrase: I would like to move to a warm place.
japanese.fnphrase: 暖かい所に引越ししたい。

japanese.enphrase: It is too hot to go anywhere today.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日は、暑くてどこへもいけない。

japanese.enphrase: I do not like winter because it is cold.
japanese.fnphrase: 冬は寒いから嫌いだ。

japanese.enphrase: It is hot and humid in Japan during the summer.
japanese.fnphrase: 日本の夏は蒸し暑い。

japanese.enphrase: I want to have tasty iced coffee.
japanese.fnphrase: おいしいアイスコーヒーが飲みたい。

japanese.enphrase: That person has no friends because he is self-centered.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano hito wa jikochuu dakara, tomodachiga daremo inai.
japanese.fnphrase: あの人は自己中だから、友達が誰もいない。

japanese.enphrase: She gets on my nerves.
japanese.fnphrase: あの子にはむかつくよ。

japanese.enphrase: The groupies of the popular band followed the band on nationwide tour.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ninki band no okkake ga, zenkoku tsuâ ni tsuite kita.
japanese.fnphrase: 人気バンドの追っかけが、全国ツアーについてきた。

japanese.enphrase: Don't be snobby.
japanese.fnphrase: 気障なセリフを言わないで。

japanese.enphrase: I love Sudoku very much.
japanese.fnphrase: ナンプレが大好きです。

japanese.enphrase: I am into video games.
japanese.fnphrase: テレビゲームにはまってます。

japanese.enphrase: He is an anime geek.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tamaka san wa anime otaku desuyo.
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんはアニメオタクですよ。

japanese.enphrase: My mother is getting old.
japanese.fnphrase: 母は最近老けてきた。

japanese.enphrase: The life of a part-time worker is unstable.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Furîtâ wa seikatsu ga antei shinai.
japanese.fnphrase: フリーターは生活が安定しない。

japanese.enphrase: I want to get married not using a formal blind date, but by falling in love.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Omiai ja nakute, renai shite kekkon shitai.
japanese.fnphrase: お見合いじゃなくて、恋愛して結婚したい。

japanese.enphrase: If I get a failing score again, I might have to repeat a year in school.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kondo akaten o tottara rakudai kamoshirenai.
japanese.fnphrase: 今度赤点をとったら、落第かもしれない。

japanese.enphrase: If you cheat on an exam, you will be expelled.
japanese.fnphrase: カンニングしたら退学になります。

japanese.enphrase: I was hit on at Shibuya.
japanese.fnphrase: 渋谷でナンパされた。

japanese.enphrase: Comedy TV shows are popular.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Owarai bangumi wa ninki ga aru.
japanese.fnphrase: お笑い番組は人気がある

japanese.enphrase: Be careful with suspicious people.
japanese.fnphrase: 怪しい人には気をつけて。

japanese.enphrase: I can no longer wear the clothes that I used to wear when I was an office worker.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: ôeru no tokino fuku ga mou kirarenai.
japanese.fnphrase: OLの時の服がもう着られない。

japanese.enphrase: I cannot play volleyball because I am short.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Chibi dakara, barê bôru ga dekimasen.
japanese.fnphrase: ちびだから、バレーボールができません。

japanese.enphrase: I got fired because I slacked off.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Shigoto o sabotte kubi ni natta.
japanese.fnphrase: 仕事をさぼって首になった。

japanese.enphrase: Digital cameras are convenient.
japanese.fnphrase: デジカメは便利だ。

japanese.enphrase: Fill up with premium gasoline, please.
japanese.fnphrase: ハイオクをお願いします。

japanese.enphrase: I skipped school and went to an amusement park.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gakkou o sabotte yuuenchi e itta.
japanese.fnphrase: 学校をさぼって遊園地へ行った。

japanese.enphrase: My teacher found out that I skipped a class.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Zuruyasumi o shitakoto ga sensei ni bareta.
japanese.fnphrase: ずる休みをしたことが先生にばれた。

japanese.enphrase: Kind men are popular with women.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Yasashii otoko no hito wa moteru.
japanese.fnphrase: やさしい男の人はもてる。

japanese.enphrase: I plan to go on a diet in order to wear a bathing suit.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mizugi o kiru tame ni daietto suru tsumori desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 水着を着るためにダイエットするつもりです。

japanese.enphrase: My sister looks nice in red.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ane wa aka ga yoku niau.
japanese.fnphrase: 姉は赤がよく似合う。

japanese.enphrase: The food that my mother cooks is delicious.
japanese.fnphrase: 母の料理はうまい。

japanese.enphrase: I have a good story, so I feel that I can write a good article.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ii neta ga atta node, iikiji ga kakesouda.
japanese.fnphrase: いいネタがあったので、いい記事が書けそうだ。

japanese.enphrase: I have been in good shape lately.
japanese.fnphrase: 最近、調子がいい。

japanese.translation: a sucker for a handsome face
japanese.enphrase: She is a sucker for a handsome face.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼女は面食いだ。

japanese.enphrase: I have just sent mail to my boyfriend.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Imakare ni mêru o sita tokoro desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 今彼にメールしたところです。

japanese.enphrase: I am going on a date with my girlfriend now.
japanese.fnphrase: これから今カノとデートです。

japanese.enphrase: That is a popular store among young girls.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gyaru ni ninki no mise desu.
japanese.fnphrase: ギャルに人気の店です。

japanese.enphrase: Mr. Tanaka's joke is boring.
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんのギャグはつまらない。

japanese.enphrase: I want a new personal computer.
japanese.fnphrase: 新しいパソコンがほしい。

japanese.enphrase: I am looking for a job using a mobile device.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mobairu o katsuyou shite shigoto o sagashimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: モバイルを活用して仕事を探します。

japanese.translation: TV show that are mainly broadcast via mobile device(s)
japanese.enphrase: I want a new cell phone that shows TV.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Wansegu kinou tsuki no keitai ga hoshii.
japanese.fnphrase: ワンセグ機能付きの携帯がほしい。

japanese.enphrase: I was woken up by a prank call.
japanese.fnphrase: いた電に起こされた。

japanese.enphrase: That is a cute decorated cell phone.
japanese.fnphrase: そのデコ電、かわいいね。

japanese.enphrase: My English teacher is a handsome man.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Eigo no sensei wa nimaime desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 英語の先生は二枚目です。

japanese.enphrase: He is a comedy actor.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare wa sanmaime no yakusha da.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼は三枚目の役者だ。

japanese.enphrase: You are foolish to make such a mistake.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sonna shippai o shite manuke dana.
japanese.fnphrase: そんな失敗をしてまぬけだな。

japanese.enphrase: I heard that the manager sexually harassed his co-worker.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Buchou ga sekuhara o shita souda
japanese.fnphrase: 部長がセクハラをしたそうだ。

japanese.enphrase: You are so sloppy.
japanese.fnphrase: ずぼらな性格だね。

japanese.enphrase: It is luxury to go to restaurants every day.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mainichi resutoran ni ikuno wa zeitaku desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 毎日レストランに行くのは贅沢です。

japanese.enphrase: I want to go to a first-rate restaurant.
japanese.fnphrase: 一流レストランに行きたい。

japanese.enphrase: Even though it was a second-rate hotel, the service was good.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Niryuu hoteru to ittemo sâbisu wa yokatta.
japanese.fnphrase: 二流ホテルといっても、サービスはよかった。

japanese.enphrase: The price was first-rate but the taste was third-rate.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Nedan wa ichiryuu nanoni aji wa sanryuu datta.
japanese.fnphrase: 値段は一流なのに、味は三流だった。

japanese.enphrase: A refrigerated cold beer is the best.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Reizouko de hiyashita bîru wa saikou da.
japanese.fnphrase: 冷蔵庫で冷やしたビールは最高だ。

japanese.enphrase: I drink hot tea after it cools down.
japanese.fnphrase: お茶を冷ましてから飲む。

japanese.enphrase: Today, I am lucky.
japanese.fnphrase: 今日は運がいい。

japanese.enphrase: I was downsized from my job.
japanese.fnphrase: リストラされた。

japanese.enphrase: The election is going to start.
japanese.fnphrase: 選挙が始まる。

japanese.enphrase: People can vote after they turn 18 years old in Japan.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Nihon dewa, juuhassai kara touhyou dekiru.
japanese.fnphrase: 日本では、18歳から投票できる。

japanese.enphrase: He is a strong candidate.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare wa yuuryoku na kouhosha da.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼は有力な候補者だ。

japanese.enphrase: The number of families having only one child is increasing in Japan.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Nihon dewa hitorikko ga fuete iru.
japanese.fnphrase: 日本では一人っ子が増えている。

japanese.enphrase: That child is spoiled.
japanese.fnphrase: あの子供は甘えん坊です。

japanese.enphrase: The number of latchkey kids is increasing.
japanese.fnphrase: 鍵っ子が増えている。

japanese.enphrase: I am having a disagreement with my mother.
japanese.fnphrase: 母ともめている。

japanese.enphrase: Representatives of the developed countries gathered.
japanese.fnphrase: 先進国の代表が集まった。

japanese.enphrase: There are many developing countries in the south.
japanese.fnphrase: 発展途上国は南に多い。

japanese.enphrase: He is running for President.
japanese.fnphrase: 大統領に立候補する。

japanese.enphrase: We do not know who will be elected.
japanese.fnphrase: 誰が当選するかわからない。

japanese.enphrase: I started to gain weight after I became a middle aged person.
japanese.fnphrase: 中年になってから太ってきた。

japanese.enphrase: I did not know that he was such a stingy man.
japanese.fnphrase: そんなせこい人だとは知らなかった。

japanese.enphrase: Of course, I will attend.
japanese.fnphrase: もちろん、出席します。

japanese.enphrase: I am keeping it a secret from my husband that I am saving money.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Hesokuri o shiteirukoto wa shujin niwa himitsu desu.
japanese.fnphrase: へそくりをしてることは、主人には秘密です。

japanese.enphrase: He is the most likely candidate to be the next president of the company.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kare ga jikishachou no honmei desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼が次期社長の本命です。

japanese.enphrase: I want a shaggy cut.
japanese.fnphrase: シャギーに切ってください。

japanese.enphrase: I would like to know Jewish culture.
japanese.fnphrase: ユダヤ人の文化を知りたい。

japanese.enphrase: I take supplements every morning.
japanese.fnphrase: 毎朝サプリをとっています。

japanese.enphrase: The joke cracked everyone up.
japanese.fnphrase: ギャグがうけた。

japanese.enphrase: I am saving money in order to go to Hawaii.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Hawai ni iku tame ni setsuyaku siteimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: ハワイに行くために節約しています。

japanese.enphrase: At night, we say "Oyasuminasai" instead of "Sayoonara"
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Yoru wa sayounara janakute "oyasuminasai" to iimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 夜は「さようなら」じゃなくて「おやすみなさい」と言います。

japanese.enphrase: Yuko has a father complex.
japanese.fnphrase: ゆうこはファザコンだね。

japanese.enphrase: That actor is an amateur.
japanese.fnphrase: あの役者は素人だね。

japanese.enphrase: After brushing my teeth, I went to bed.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ha o migaita atode beddo ni haitta.
japanese.fnphrase: 歯を磨いた後でベッドに入った。

japanese.enphrase: I am learning to play piano.
japanese.fnphrase: ピアノを習っています。

japanese.enphrase: When I am with children, I feel better.
japanese.fnphrase: 子供といると癒されます。

japanese.enphrase: Young people today flip out easily.
japanese.fnphrase: 最近の若者はきれやすい。

japanese.enphrase: I go to work by bicycle.
japanese.fnphrase: チャリで通勤しています。

japanese.enphrase: That movie is seriously funny.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sono eiga wa maji de omoshiroi.
japanese.fnphrase: その映画はまじでおもしろい。

japanese.enphrase: Because it is cold, you had better wear a scarf.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Samui kara mafurâ o shiteitta houga iiyo.
japanese.fnphrase: 寒いから、マフラーをして行った方がいいよ。

japanese.enphrase: My friend said "don't mind" to me when I was down after making a mistake.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tomodachi ga, sippai o site ochikondeiru watasini "donmai" to itte kureta.
japanese.fnphrase: 友達が、失敗をして落ち込んでいる私に「ドンマイ」と言ってくれた。

japanese.enphrase: My brother has withdrawn from scociety since middle school.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Otouto wa chuugaku no toki kara hikikomori desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟は中学の時から引きこもりです。

japanese.enphrase: I am a golf beginner, so I play poorly.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gorufu no shoshinsha nanode mada heta desu.
japanese.fnphrase: ゴルフの初心者なので、まだ下手です。

japanese.enphrase: He has a trauma from being bullied as a child.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kodomo no toki ni ijimerareta koto ga, torauma ni natteiru.
japanese.fnphrase: 子供の時にいじめられたことが、トラウマになっている。

japanese.enphrase: You'd better flatter the president.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Shachou ni yoisho shite oita houga ii.
japanese.fnphrase: 社長によいしょしておいたほうがいい。

japanese.enphrase: My mother is a genius at cooking.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Haha wa ryouri no tensai desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 母は料理の天才です。

japanese.enphrase: I decided to exercise because I have metabolic syndrome.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Metabo dakara undou o hajimeru kotoni shita.
japanese.fnphrase: メタボだから、運動を始めることにした。

japanese.enphrase: I bought sweets at the supermarket.
japanese.fnphrase: スーパーでお菓子を買った。

japanese.enphrase: I have the same clothes as my teacher.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sensei to onazi fuku o motte imasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 先生と同じ服を持っています。

japanese.enphrase: My friend entered my house saying "Excuse me."
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: "Ojamashimasu" to iinagara, tomodachi ga ie ni haitte kita.
japanese.fnphrase: 「おじゃまします。」と言いながら、友達が家に入ってきた。

japanese.enphrase: There are many pre-arranged performances in this TV documentary.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono terebi dokyumentarî wa yarase ga ooi.
japanese.fnphrase: このテレビドキュメンタリーはやらせが多い。

japanese.enphrase: That scarf is very fashionable.
japanese.fnphrase: そのスカーフはおしゃれですね。

japanese.enphrase: I cannot recall his name.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼の名前が思い出せない。

japanese.enphrase: Welcome. What are you looking for?
japanese.fnphrase: いらっしゃいませ。何をお探しですか。

japanese.enphrase: The sale starts soon.
japanese.fnphrase: セールがもうすぐ始まるよ。

japanese.enphrase: I called my ex-girlfriend.
japanese.fnphrase: 元カノに電話をかけた。

japanese.enphrase: I bumped into my ex-boyfriend.
japanese.fnphrase: 元カレに会ってしまった。

japanese.enphrase: Many people come to Kyoto.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Takusan no hito ga kyouto ni kimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: たくさんの人が京都に来ます。

japanese.enphrase: What I bought overseas turned out to be an imitation.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi ga kaigai de katta mono wa nisemono datta.
japanese.fnphrase: 私が海外で買ったものは偽物だった。

japanese.enphrase: Cleaning is my duty.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Souji wa watashi no gimu desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 掃除は私の義務です。

japanese.enphrase: The company sent a group of specialists to the accident site.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kigyou wa supesharisuto no gurûpu o jikogenba ni haken shita.
japanese.fnphrase: 企業はスペシャリストのグループを事故現場に派遣した 。

japanese.enphrase: It's humid today, isn't it?
japanese.fnphrase: 今日は湿気てるね。

japanese.enphrase: My teacher gave some sweets to my brother.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sensei ga otouto ni okashi o kureta.
japanese.fnphrase: 先生が弟にお菓子をくれた。

japanese.enphrase: I said "Gochisoosama" after the meal.
japanese.fnphrase: ”ごちそうさまでした”と言った。

japanese.enphrase: My mother always tells me to clean up my room.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Haha wa itsumo watashi ni heya o katazukeru youni iimasu.
japanese.fnphrase: 母はいつも私に部屋を片付けるよう言います。

japanese.enphrase: It is hard to tell the original from the fake.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Honmono to nisemono o miwakeru nowa muzukashii.
japanese.fnphrase: 本物と偽物を見分けるのは難しい。

japanese.enphrase: I gained weight over the Christmas holiday.
japanese.fnphrase: クリスマス休暇中、太ってしまった。

japanese.enphrase: My father lost weight thanks to exercise.
japanese.fnphrase: 父はエクササイズで痩せた。

japanese.enphrase: That actress is a comfort to everyone. I am a fan of her.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano iyashikei joyuu no fan desu.
japanese.fnphrase: あの癒し系女優のファンです。

japanese.enphrase: I am suffering from a terrible stiff shoulder.
japanese.fnphrase: 肩凝りが酷くて辛いです。

japanese.enphrase: I saw my girlfriend home.
japanese.fnphrase: 彼女をうちまで送っていった。

japanese.enphrase: It's a hassle to write a letter.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tegami o kaku nowa mendou kusai.
japanese.fnphrase: 手紙を書くのはめんどうくさい。

japanese.enphrase: Mrs. Tanaka is a lovely person.
japanese.fnphrase: 田中さんは素敵な人です。

japanese.enphrase: I was surprised to hear that my American friend said "konnichiwa" at 7 O'clock in the evening.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Amerikajin no tomodachi ga gogo shichijini "konnichiwa" to itta node odoroite shimatta.
japanese.fnphrase: アメリカ人の友達が午後７時に「こんにちは。」と言ったので、おどろいてしまった。

japanese.enphrase: While prices are high, I am trying to make ends meet.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Bukkadaka no naka, kakei o nantoka yarikuri suru.
japanese.fnphrase: 物価高の中、家計を何とかやりくりする。

japanese.enphrase: Those clothes are cute.
japanese.fnphrase: あの洋服、かわいい。

japanese.enphrase: That's a cool car, isnt' it?
japanese.fnphrase: かっこいい車だね。

japanese.enphrase: The collaboration of these two artists made this wonderful song.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Futari no âthisuto ga korabo shite subarasii kyoku o tsukutta.
japanese.fnphrase: 二人のアーティストがコラボして素晴らしい曲を作った。

japanese.enphrase: Take the umbrella with you, as it looks like it's going to rain.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Amega furisou dakara, kasa o motte itta houga iiyo.
japanese.fnphrase: 雨が降りそうだから、傘を持って行った方がいいよ。

japanese.enphrase: The owner of the apartment demands the security deposit of one month's rent and another one month for the key money.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono apâto no shikikin to reikin ga sorezore ikkagetsubun hitsuyou da.
japanese.fnphrase: このアパートの敷金と礼金がそれぞれ1か月分必要だ。

japanese.enphrase: Remember to bring a souvenir for your friends after returning from traveling.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ryokou no ato wa, tomodachi ni omiyage o wasurenaide.
japanese.fnphrase: 旅行の後は、友達にお土産を忘れないで。

japanese.enphrase: It reminds me of my mother's cooking.
japanese.fnphrase: 母の料理が懐かしい。

japanese.enphrase: Do not eat too many sweets for a snack.
japanese.fnphrase: お菓子を食べすぎないで。

japanese.enphrase: I am very happy to have my children.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kodomo ni megumarete totemo shiawase desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 子供に恵まれてとても幸せです。

japanese.enphrase: The grandpa's way of thinking is old.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ano ojiisan no kangaekata wa furui.
japanese.fnphrase: あのおじいさんの考え方は古い。

japanese.enphrase: This company's retirement age is 65.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kono kaisha no teinen wa 65 sai desu.
japanese.fnphrase: この会社の定年は65歳です。

japanese.enphrase: The deadline of the application is tomorrow.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Gansho no shimekiri wa asu desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 願書の締め切りは明日です。

japanese.enphrase: A banker earns a lot of money.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Ginkouin wa okane o takusan kasegu.
japanese.fnphrase: 銀行員はお金をたくさん稼ぐ。

japanese.enphrase: This is not enough.
japanese.fnphrase: これだけじゃ足りないです。

japanese.enphrase: The breakfast was not tasty.
japanese.fnphrase: 朝ごはんはまずかった。

japanese.enphrase: Cell phones are very convenient.
japanese.fnphrase: 携帯はとても便利です。

japanese.enphrase: I watered my flower.
japanese.fnphrase: 花に水をやった。

japanese.enphrase: Thank you for lending me the book.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Hon o kashite kurete doumo arigatou.
japanese.fnphrase: 本を貸してくれてどうもありがとう。

japanese.enphrase: No thank you. I am full.
japanese.fnphrase: お腹がいっぱいなので結構です。

japanese.enphrase: You must say "Shitsureishimasu" when you enter the president's room.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Shachou no heya ni hairu toki wa "shitsurei shimasu" to iwanakereba naranai.
japanese.fnphrase: 社長の部屋に入るときは「失礼します」と言わなければならない。

japanese.enphrase: My brother does not say "I'm sorry", no matter what he does.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Otouto wa nani o shitemo "gomennasai" to iwanai.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟は何をしても「ごめんなさい。」と言わない。

japanese.enphrase: Excuse me. Please give me this.
japanese.fnphrase: すみません。これをください。

japanese.enphrase: I said "I am very sorry about that" to the client when I accidentally stepped on his foot.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Okyakusama no ashi o funde shimattanode, "shitsurei simashita" to iimashita.
japanese.fnphrase: お客様の足を踏んでしまったので、「失礼しました」といいました。

japanese.enphrase: I do not want to marry a mama's boy.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mazakon no otoko towa kekkon shitakunai.
japanese.fnphrase: マザコンの男とは結婚したくない。

japanese.enphrase: Environmental issues are everybody's problem.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Kankyoumondai wa minna no mondai da.
japanese.fnphrase: 環境問題はみんなの問題だ。

japanese.enphrase: Let's take the shortcut home.
japanese.fnphrase: 近道して家に帰ろう。

japanese.enphrase: It's hard to have this much overtime work.
japanese.fnphrase: 残業が多くて大変だ。

japanese.enphrase: I saw an old neighbor at the supermarket and asked him "How are you?"
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sûpâ de kinjo no ojiisan ni atta node, "ogenkidesuka" to kiita.
japanese.fnphrase: スーパーで近所のおじいさんに会ったので、「お元気ですか」と聞いた。

japanese.enphrase: The students have been distracted.
japanese.fnphrase: 学生がだれてきた。

japanese.enphrase: It would be good to buy it when it is a bargain.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Bâgen no toki ni katta houga iiyo.
japanese.fnphrase: バーゲンの時に買った方がいいよ。

japanese.enphrase: When I scolded a student who was smoking, he snapped at me.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Tabako o sutteiru gakusei o chuui shitara gyakugire sareta.
japanese.fnphrase: タバコを吸っている学生を注意したら、逆ギレされた。

japanese.enphrase: I went to the airport to pick up my aunt.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Oba o kuukou made mukae ni itta.
japanese.fnphrase: おばを空港まで迎えに行った。

japanese.translation: I have not seen you for a long time.
japanese.enphrase: I said "I have not seen you for a long time" to my teacher because 2 years has been past since I saw him last.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Sannen buri ni sensei ni atta node, "ohisashiburidesu" to itta.
japanese.fnphrase: ３年ぶりに先生に会ったので、「お久しぶりです」と言った。

japanese.enphrase: See you later, Mr. Tanaka.
japanese.fnphrase: じゃあ、また。田中さん。

japanese.enphrase: This dress is a good bargain.
japanese.fnphrase: このドレスがお買い得です。

japanese.enphrase: We lost today's match.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Bokutachi no kyou no shiai wa kuroboshi datta.
japanese.fnphrase: 僕たちの今日の試合は黒星だった。

japanese.enphrase: I think I will go to Tokyo tomorrow.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Asu toukyou ni ikou to omoi masu.
japanese.fnphrase: 明日、東京に行こうと思います。

japanese.enphrase: I got very tired yesterday.
japanese.fnphrase: 昨日はとても疲れた。

japanese.enphrase: It's time for a snack.
japanese.fnphrase: おやつの時間ですよ。

japanese.enphrase: Many companies went out of business due to the recession.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Fukeiki de takusan no kaisha ga tousan shita.
japanese.fnphrase: 不景気でたくさんの会社が倒産した。

japanese.enphrase: I am good at math.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa suugaku ga tokui desu
japanese.fnphrase: 私は数学が得意です。

japanese.enphrase: I owe you one.
japanese.fnphrase: 恩に着るよ。

japanese.enphrase: I am poor at physics.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Watashi wa butsuri ga nigate desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は物理が苦手です。

japanese.enphrase: I heard that company is making a profit.
japanese.fnphrase: あの会社は儲かっているらしい。

japanese.enphrase: I considered a better way.
japanese.fnphrase: もっといい方法を考えた。

japanese.enphrase: Doing dishes is my job.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Araimono wa watashi no shigoto desu.
japanese.fnphrase: 洗い物は私の仕事です。

japanese.enphrase: I gave my brother some sweets.
japanese.fnphrase: 弟にお菓子を上げた。

japanese.enphrase: We won the game after losing many.
japanese.fnphrase: 久しぶりの白星だ。

japanese.enphrase: My daily life is fulfilling.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Mainichi no seikatsu ga juujitsu shiteiru.
japanese.fnphrase: 毎日の生活が充実している。

japanese.enphrase: I passed the entrance exam of the university.
japanese.fnphrase: 大学試験に合格した。

japanese.enphrase: You had better not carry cash around.
japanese.wotd:transliteratedSentence: Genkin o amari mochiarukanai houga ii.
japanese.fnphrase: 現金をあまり持ち歩かないほうがいい。

japanese.enphrase: I have an allergy to pollen.
japanese.fnphrase: 私は花粉アレルギーです。
